revised_title: Effect of Crystal Size and High-Speed Particle Irradiation on Explosive Decomposition
tldr: The authors studied the effect of high-speed particle irradiation and crystal size on the explosive decomposition of various sensitive explosives, such as lead azide, silver azide, and nitrogen iodide. They found that the limiting size for explosion is of the order of a few microns and that the necessary hot-spot size is large on a molecular scale. The experiments also showed that the activation of a small group of adjacent molecules is not enough to cause explosion, and that decomposition takes place preferentially at defects within the crystal structure.
